prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
Detective Gumshoe is testifying about the incriminating evidence against Maya Fey, which is her costume she was wearing.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant until a year ago. Now she's training to be a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Dr. Turner Grey
Description: The director of the Grey Surgical Clinic where the malpractice incident occurred.
Character 2
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ran away as soon as she saw me. A girl who is Maya's little cousin.
Character 3
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Maya's aunt. She has a strange, powerful aura about her.
Character 4
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be an investigative photographer. She lives for the next big scoop.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Ini Miney
Description: College student. A huge fan of the occult and is doing research in parapsychology.
Character 7
Name: Mimi Miney
Description: Died in a car accident 1 year ago. Was Ini's older sister, nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.
Character 8
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister. She was a top notch lawyer and my mentor and friend forever.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Became a prosecutor in Germany at age 13. A prodigy who has never known defeat.
Character 10
Name: Ami Fey
Description: Kurain Channeling Technique founder. Legend says her soul is sealed in the Sacred Urn.
Character 11
Name: Director Hotti (purported)
Description: A peculiar patient who claims to be Director Hotti. Seems to be extremely "healthy".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.
Evidence 2
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 3
Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.
Evidence 4
Name: Folding Screen
Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.
Evidence 5
Name: Black Key
Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.
Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...? 
Evidence 7
Name: Floor Plans (Crime Scene)
Description: A diagram of the Channeling Chamber. A four sectioned mat in front of a platform at the head.
Evidence 8
Name: Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report
Description: After being stabbed in the chest, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. Stabbed in chest then shot at point-blank. Gunpowder residue around bullet hole.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol
Description: Murder weapon. Was Grey's. Two shots fired. Bears Maya's and Grey's fingerprints.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Murder weapon. A small fruit knife. Belongs to the Fey's. Bears Maya's fingerprints.
Evidence 11
Name: Maya's Costume
Description: Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. There are blood splatters on it. Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. [caption] It is stained with blood splatter and a bullet hole is present in the sleeve. The robe is otherwise clean. It is purple in color.
Evidence 12
Name: Lotta's Photo 1
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is a photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot.
Evidence 13
Name: Lotta's Photo 2
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is the second photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot behind her.
Evidence 14
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: Ami Fey's spirit is sealed within. It's chipped and cracked all over. Broken by Pearl right before the murder. Under repair in the hallway until police came.
Evidence 15
Name: Cloth Scrap
Description: Unburned remains found inside the garden incinerator. Small amount of blood is on it.
Evidence 16
Name: Pearl's Ball
Description: Pearl's favorite toy. She was playing with this at the time of the murder, it seems.
Evidence 17
Name: Clothing Box
Description: There is a hole that looks like a bullet hole about 8 inches off the ground.
Evidence 18
Name: License Photo
Description: Ini's photo for her driver's license. Director Hotti's treasured possession.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Sorry, pal, but there's an even more incriminating piece of evidence.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: This is the costume the defendant was wearing at the time of the crime.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: As you can see, it's covered in blood.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The defendant attacked and killed a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back.
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The goal is to pick one pair where the evidence directly contradicts a specific testimony.

First, let's look at the testimonies from Detective Gumshoe. Testimony 3 says: "The defendant attacked and killed a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back." So he's claiming Maya attacked someone who wasn't resisting. The key here is the implication that the victim was passive, not fighting back. 

Now, checking the evidence related to the murder. The autopsy report (Evidence 8) states that Dr. Grey was first stabbed in the chest and then shot at point-blank. The gunpowder residue around the bullet hole suggests a close-range shot. The pistol (Evidence 9) has two shots fired and has both Maya's and Grey's fingerprints. The knife (Evidence 10) has Maya's fingerprints. But how does this relate to Testimony 3?

Wait, the key contradiction might be in the fact that if Dr. Grey was shot at point-blank with his own gun, and the gun has his fingerprints, perhaps he was holding it when shot. But that might not directly contradict. Let's look at the other evidence.

Maya's Costume (Evidence 11) has blood splatters and a bullet hole in the sleeve. The presence of a bullet hole in her sleeve suggests she was shot at. If her costume has a bullet hole, that means someone shot at her. But Testimony 3 claims the victim wasn't fighting back. If Dr. Grey was the one who was attacked, but he had a gun and fired it (as per the pistol's two shots), then he might have been fighting back by shooting at Maya. That would contradict Testimony 3 which says the victim wasn't fighting back. So if the victim (Dr. Grey) fired the gun, leaving a bullet hole in Maya's sleeve, he was indeed fighting back, contradicting Gumshoe's testimony that he wasn't.

So the contradiction here would be between Testimony 3 (victim didn't fight back) and Evidence 11 (Maya's costume has a bullet hole, implying the victim shot at her, thus fought back). That makes sense. Therefore, the pair is Evidence 11 and Testimony 3.

{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 3}

Testimonies:
Testimony 0

Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1

Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: While the two were fighting, the victim took out his gun.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: The defendant then picked up on the opening and took the victim's gun, and ended it...
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. The user is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The characters, evidences, and testimonies are all given. So first, I need to go through each testimony and check the evidence to find contradictions.

Looking at the testimonies from Detective Gumshoe. Testimony 0 says Maya stabbed the victim in the chest during the channeling. Then the victim fought back, took out his gun (Testimony 2), missed because they were too close (Testimony 3), and Maya took the gun and shot him (Testimony 4). 

Now, check the evidence. Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report (Evidence 8) states he was first stabbed in the chest, then shot in the forehead at point-blank with gunpowder residue. The Pistol (Evidence 9) has two shots fired, with both Maya and Grey's fingerprints. 

But wait, Testimony 3 says the victim (Grey) took a shot and missed because they were too close. However, the Autopsy Report says he was shot in the forehead after being stabbed. If Grey fired a shot that missed, then the gun would have been fired once before Maya took it. But the Pistol has two shots fired. So maybe the first shot was Grey's miss, and the second was Maya shooting him. But the autopsy says he was shot once in the forehead. Also, the gunpowder residue on the forehead suggests a point-blank shot, which would be Maya's shot. But if Grey fired first and missed, that shot would be one, and Maya's shot the second. However, the autopsy only mentions the shot to the forehead. That seems contradictory because if Grey fired a shot, there should be a bullet somewhere else, but the evidence doesn't mention another bullet hole except in the folding screen (Evidence 4) and clothing box (Evidence 17), which are 8 inches off the ground. The bullet hole in Maya's costume (Evidence 11) is in the sleeve. So maybe the first shot hit her sleeve. 

Wait, in Testimony 3, Gumshoe says the victim took a shot but missed because they were too close. If they were too close, how could he miss? Unless the bullet hit Maya's sleeve. Evidence 11 (Maya's Costume) has a bullet hole in the sleeve. So the first shot (Grey's) hit her sleeve, which would be the hole. Then Maya took the gun and shot him. That would account for two shots. The Autopsy Report says he was shot once. But the Pistol (Evidence 9) says two shots fired. So the two shots would be the one that hit Maya's sleeve and the one that killed Grey. That matches. But the contradiction might be in the Testimony 3 saying that Grey missed, but the bullet actually hit Maya's sleeve. But Gumshoe's testimony says "he missed", but the evidence shows the bullet hit her sleeve. So that's a contradiction. Because if the shot hit her sleeve, he didn't miss; he hit her. Therefore, Testimony 3 (Grey missed) is contradicted by Evidence 11 (bullet hole in sleeve). 

Another angle: Testimony 4 says Maya took the gun and "ended it", implying she shot him. So the two shots would be Grey's first (which hit the sleeve) and Maya's second (killed him). But the autopsy says he was shot once. Wait, but the Pistol evidence says two shots were fired. So both shots were from the same gun. So the first shot hit Maya's sleeve (from Grey firing), and the second shot Maya fired into his forehead. That would align with two shots. However, the Testimony 3 says Grey missed, but if the bullet hit her sleeve, he didn't miss. So the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (Grey's shot missed) and Evidence 11 (bullet hole in Maya's sleeve, indicating he hit her). Therefore, Testimony 3 is contradicted by Evidence 11.

{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 3}
